57.57001001: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,
57.57001002: And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:
57.57001003: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
57.57001004: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
57.57001005: Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;
57.57001006: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.
57.57001007: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.
57.57001008: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,
57.57001009: Yet for love’s sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.
57.57001010: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:
57.57001011: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:
57.57001012: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:
57.57001013: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:
57.57001014: But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.
57.57001015: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;
57.57001016: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?
57.57001017: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.
57.57001018: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;
57.57001019: I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.
57.57001020: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.
57.57001021: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.
57.57001022: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.
57.57001023: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;
57.57001024: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.
57.57001025: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
